meanings.definition: To have shed or cast off (something, such as a skin or feathers)
meanings.sent1: The snake shedded its old skin to grow bigger.
meanings.sent2: She shedded her winter coat as the weather warmed up.
meanings.sent3: The bird shedded its feathers all over the yard, creating a fluffy mess.
meanings.sent4: After the breakup, she shedded her old self and embraced a new beginning.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar shedded its cocoon and emerged as a beautiful butterfly.

meanings.definition: To have gotten rid of or disposed of (something unwanted or unnecessary)
meanings.sent1: He shedded his old clothes to make room for new ones.
meanings.sent2: The company shedded unnecessary expenses to improve profitability.
meanings.sent3: She shedded her bad habits like a snake shedding its skin.
meanings.sent4: The town shedded its outdated image and embraced modernization.
meanings.sent5: The tree shedded its dead leaves, preparing for the arrival of spring.
